name: Malnutrition
description: Creatures that do not consume adequate food suffer exhaustion from starvation
trigger: Eating less than half required food for a day, or eating nothing for 5 days

savingThrow.onSuccess: No Exhaustion gained (when eating less than half required food)
savingThrow.onFailure: Gain 1 Exhaustion level at day's end

ongoing: If eating but consuming less than half required food: DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 Exhaustion level at day's end
If eating nothing for 5 days: automatically gain 1 Exhaustion level at end of fifth day
Each subsequent day without food: automatically gain 1 additional Exhaustion level

mitigation: Eat at least half the required food amount to have a chance to avoid Exhaustion
Carry adequate food supplies (rations) during travel
Forage for food using Wisdom (Survival) checks
Create food using magic (e.g., Create Food and Water spell, Goodberry spell)
Purchase or trade for food at settlements

recovery.requirement: Exhaustion caused by malnutrition can't be removed until the creature eats the full amount of food required for a day
recovery.normalRecovery: After eating full food requirement, Exhaustion can be removed by Long Rest as normal

srdReference.quote: A creature needs an amount of food per day based on its size, as shown in the Food Needs per Day table. A creature that eats but consumes less than half the required food for a day must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 Exhaustion level at the day's end. A creature that eats nothing for 5 days automatically gains 1 Exhaustion level at the end of the fifth day as well as an additional level at the end of each subsequent day without food. Exhaustion caused by malnutrition can't be removed until the creature eats the full amount of food required for a day.

examples: Traveling through barren wasteland without sufficient rations
Lost in wilderness unable to forage successfully
Siege situation with dwindling food supplies
Eating half rations to extend supplies (requires daily CON save)
